meanings.definition: A person who rants or speaks loudly and aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The ranters in the meeting were very loud and made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent2: The ranters at the protest were shouting slogans and waving banners.
meanings.sent3: The ranters in the park were so loud that even the birds flew away.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a swarm of angry bees, the ranters buzzing in everyone's ears.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ranters yelling will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A group of people who engage in loud and aggressive speech or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The ranters gathered outside the courthouse, demanding justice.
meanings.sent2: The group of ranters in the debate club always made their opinions known.
meanings.sent3: The ranters in the cafeteria were like a thunderstorm in a teacup.
meanings.sent4: Their arguments clashed like swords, the ranters fighting for their beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The crowd of ranters created a chaotic symphony of voices.
